events.1317: Saint Gora Kumbhar, an intense devotee of the deity Vitthal at Pandharpur, took Samadhi in Ter village in Osmanabad Zilla, near Latur.
events.1760: Gerard George Clifford, head of East-Indian Company, passed away at the age of 75.
events.1875: Swami Dayanand Saraswati established the Arya Samaj at Bombay and in 1877 in Lahore.
events.1880: C.Y. Chintamani, renowned journalist, was born.
events.1901: Amiya Chakravarty, educationist, was born at Serampore in West Bengal.
events.1919: Miss Mercia Sherwood, an English teacher, was assaulted by a mob in Amritsar. Brig. General. R.E.H. Dyer had given instructions to beat her.
events.1930: Police raid the headquarters of the Indian National Congress, Bombay.
events.1931: Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, who worked in the region of Sahkar and Education, was born.
events.1935: Vasudevaru Kesavaru (K.V. Manalikkera), famous writer and poet, was born at Madras.
events.1937: Shridhar Vyanktesh Ketkar, creator of Maharashtra Gyankosh and Sociologist, passed away.
events.1955: India and Vietnam affirm the Panchsheel.
events.1982: Indian National Satellite (INSAT-1A) launched. First operational multi-purpose communication and meteorology satellite procured from U.S.A.(Cape Canaveral).
events.1993: Student hijackers of IA plane overpowered in Lucknow.
events.1995: Morarji Ranchhodji Desai, first non-Congress Prime Minister of India (1977-79) and Chief Minister of Bombay, passed away at the age of 99. He was awarded with Bharat Ratna.
events.1996: The marketing of Salman Rushdie's novel 'The Moor's Last Sigh' in India was cleared by the Central govt.
events.1997: Bill Gates, Chairman and CEO of Microsoft,  announces Rs. 2.5 crore aid to Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan's Gandhi Institute of Computer Education and Information Technology, Mumbai.
events.1999: Thakazhi Sivasankara Pillai (87), patriarch of Malayalam fiction, died at his ancestral village at Sankaramangalam in Thakazhi village.
